body.p:
Hon Thos E Bramlet Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Inclosed I send you the Bond of George Renacker with J D & William Renacker as his sureties the nature of the Bond you will see. This Bond was forfeited by George Renacker's failing to attend for trial. His sureties at a subsequent term of the court produced George into court_ again entered into a Recognizance for his appearance at the next term of the court, at which term he appeared & was tried for the offence for which he was held by the Bond taken by the Justices of the Peace and tried & fined the sum of $50, Now I hope it will appear to your Honor but just to remit so much of the Judgment against J D & Wm Renacker as you are by law empowered to do They are both good citizens It is true they are able to pay the judgment & the only reason that it has not been paid long ago is, that the Renackers & the clerk were both of the opinion that the fine had been remitted by some former Gov, but no evidence of the fact can be found in the office -- The prayer for remittence is based alone on the fact that George was afterwards tried for the offence & fined $50. Now if you are of opinion that Justice would demand all the payment of the fine of $50 you are asked to remit all but $50 but it is hoped by the renackers that you will feel justified in remitting the whole
Except the Attys fees which has been paid as is shown by the records. I could get every man in the county to sign a petition to you praying for a remition of the judgment & will do it send to you a petition signed some of the officers of the county if required I am with great Respect yours &

W. T Simmons for
J D & W Renacker
